intro: Dicerma biarticulatum var. collettii, commonly known as the Collett's spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, milky sap and striking yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has a short stem with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
